availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Braxton W. Moss (Green County, Kentucky, blacksmith.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Son of Frederick Moss and Mary Coats Moss. Married to Virginia Moss. Father of Emily T. Moss, Ulysses F. Moss, Narcissa M. Moss, and James T. Moss. Blacksmith in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Blacksmith in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household (Cassandre W. Moss Haselwood) owned eight enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Household (John Edwards) owned eleven enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 1, p. 322B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 687.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 623.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 67A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 76B.
W.H. Perrin, J.H. Battle, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, vol. 4 (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey and Company, 1887), 882.
